titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the William Campbell Binkley Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

did.unittitle: Outgoing correspondence. Approximately 6,750 items, mostly carbon copies, dating from 1920 to 1970. Arranged chronologically.
Incoming correspondence. Approximately 7,800 items, from about 1400 correspondents. Arranged alphabetically.

list.item: "The Activities of the Texas Revolutionary Army after San Jacinto"
"Do the Americas Have a Common History? A United States View"
"A Historian looks at the National Union Catalog of Manuscript Collections"
"A History of the Texan Revolution" (Knopf Fellowship application, 1940)
"New Mexico and the Santa Fe Expedition"
"Public Opinion and the Teaching of History"
"Reports from a Texan Agent in New Mexico, 1849" ("Some Problems of the Historian")
"The Texan Revolutionary Army after San Jacinto"
"Two World Wars and American Historical Scholarship"
"Conditions in Texas on the Eve of the Revolution"

did.unittitle: Book reviews, arranged alphabetically by author of book:

list.item: Bannon, Bolton and the Spanish Borderlands (1964)
Barker, The Life of Stephen F. Austin (1925)
......, Mexico and Texas, 1821-1835 (1928) (w/ Castaneda, The Mexican Side of the Texan Revolution)
Bloom, New Mexico History and Civics (1933)

Forrest, Missions and Pueblos of the Old Southwest (1929)
Gambrell, Anson Jones: The Last President of Texas (1948)
Writing Southern History: Essays in Historiography in Honor of Fletcher M. Green (1965)

did.unittitle: Southwestern Historical Quarterly summaries: summaries of articles by Biesele, Brown, Christensen, Donoghue, Henderson, Holden, Lesley, Myres, Rister, Smither, B. N. Taylor, P. S. Taylor, Winston (16 summaries)

Dictionary of American History and Dictionary of American Biography entries: articles on James Davis Porter, Edward Bushrod Stahlman, Alfred Alexander Taylor, Robert Love Taylor, Republic of Texas, John Wilson Thomas, and Peter Turney

Proposals and reports: Supplementary Statements to an Application for a Grant-in-Aid by the Social Science Research Council (n.d.); Report on the Work Done during the Simmer of 1933 on a Grant-in-Aid from the Social Science Research Council for Research on a History of the Republic of Texas; Statement Concerning the Research Project of William C. Binkley, submitted to the Committee on Grants-in-Aid of the Social Science Research Council in connection with a request for a grant-in-aid (n.d.); Supplementary Statement to an Application for a Summer Grant from the University Center Research Council (n.d.); Report to the University Center Research Council on Use of Summer Grant, 1949; Report to the Committee on Grants-in-Aid of the Social Science Research Council on the use which was made of a grant-in-aid for the year 1949-1950

Miscellaneous writings: book review, The National Union Catalog of Manuscript Collections, 1962; article, "The Southwest: An Attempt at a Historical Definition"; obituaries, Andrew Bell Benedict, Louis Pelzer, Charles William Ramsdell

Published writings (offprints of articles and reviews): "A Historian Looks at the National Union Catalog of Manuscript Collections," "Two World Wars and American Historical Scholarship," reviews: Gambrell, Mirabeau Buonaparte Lamar, Troubadour and Crusader; Writing Southern History: Essays in Historiography in Honor of Fletcher M. Green; Stephenson, Southern History in the Making; White, ed., Messages of the Governors of Tennessee, Vol. VI, 1869-1883.
The Expansionist Movement in Texas, 1836-1850. Ph.D. thesis, University of California, 1923. Typed carbon.
Typescript of The Texas Revolution, chapters I-IV, with notes and comments, tentative outline, etc.
Chapter I, "The Establishment of Anglo-American Interests in Texas." 2 typed originals, with carbons and footnotes.
Chapter II, "Development of the Issue between Mexico and the Texans." 2 typed originals, with carbons and footnotes.
Chapter III, "Conditions in Texas on the Eve of the Revolution, 1833-1835." 2 typed originals, with carbons and footnotes.
Chapter IV, "The Preliminaries of the Revolution, 1834-1835." 1 typed original, with carbon and footnotes.
Chapter V, "The Struggle for the Federal Constitution." 1 typed original, with carbon and footnotes.
The Texas Revolution: notes and comments, outlines, etc.
Official Correspondence of the Texas Revolution: introductory material.
Official Correspondence of the Texas Revolution and other Texas correspondence: typed transcriptions and notes
Thomas Falconer, "Notes of a Journey through Texas and New Mexico, in the Years 1841 and 1842" (in the Journal of the Royal Geographical Society of London, 1844)
Personal material, photographs, material relating to miscel laneous projects and interests, etc., material relating to publications
Biographical and personal material, miscellaneous: resumes, membership cards, records of travel and personal possessions, tributes, certificates, Dictionary of American Scholars entries, etc., etc.
Official Correspondence of the Texas Revolution - material relating to publication
The Texas Revolution - material relating to publication, royalties, etc.
Comments on theses, papers, etc. - miscellaneous and undated
Student records, recommendations, etc. - miscellaneous and undated
Preliminary Report on the Archives of Colorado, Colorado Social Science Association
Dictionary of American Biography, Dictionary of American History, Atlas of American History material
Historical publications - University series sets (typed lists)
Historical Records Survey of Tennessee (WPA, 1936-1938) material
Territory Papers - bills, acts, resolutions, etc.
Texas Correspondence Project: "Editing and Publishing the Domestic Correspondence of the Republic of Texas," submitted to The National Historical Publications Commission
American Association for State and Local History, minutes, reports, etc.
American Historical Association, minutes, reports, etc.
American History Research Center, minutes, reports, etc.
Mississippi Valley Historical Association and Review, minutes, reports, etc.
Southern Historical Association and Journal of Southern History, 1930's through 1960's
Tennessee Historical Society, 1943- , and Tennessee history
Teaching materials from California, Colorado, Vanderbilt, Tulane, etc., including lecture and research notes, reading lists, syllabi, examinations, regulations, and miscellaneous publications.
University of California (including Bolton material for fest schrift)
Colorado College - lecture and research notes
Vanderbilt University - syllabi, reading lists, examinations, lecture outlines, etc.
Vanderbilt University - degrees granted in history
Vanderbilt University - statistical analysis of graduate students in history
Tulane University - syllabi, examinations, lecture notes, etc.
Miscellaneous notes, lists, bills, invoices, etc.
Manuscripts by other persons -- addresses by Clifford L. Lord, James W. Silver (2), and Walter Prescott Webb
Manuscripts by other persons -- articles by Rudolf Freund, Weymouth T. Jordan (2), Walter Prescott Webb, Joe Mathews, and Thomas B. Alexander
Manuscripts by other persons -- poems, proposals, outlines, abstracts, etc.
Published articles by other persons -- clippings, off prints, etc.

bibliography.p: Incoming correspondence is arranged alphabetically, by author. Other information given is as follows: in parentheses, letterhead(s) used; number of items; in parentheses, date, if one letter only, or year(s), if more than one letter.
